column1: All the simulations were performed with GPU01 and CURIE clusters

column2: Intel Xeon E5-2697A /32 Core-NVIDIA GK210GL [Tesla K80] x 4 G4GB RAM
Intel Xeon E7-4870 v2s/120 core-512GB RAM

column1: All possible conformations of the ligands are located with the semi-empirical PM3 method by using the SPARTAN software. Free rotations around single bonds are taken into account and all the geometries corresponding to stationary points are re-optimised with the Gaussian software package by density functional theory (DFT) using the M052X functional and the 6-31+G(d
column2: p) basis set. Solvation Model based on Density (SMD) method at 298.15K is used for the optimizations of the conformations in water.

column1: Thermodynamic Cycle 3 was used to calculate the pKa values of the molecules for the global minima (Equation 1)
where BH represents a reference molecule which is similar in structure to the molecules questioned
For the calculation of standard error of mean (SEM)
column2: standard deviations (stdev) are calculated according to the Equation 2 where value is the RFE of each molecule
column3: mean is the mean of RFEs of the molecules of interest and N is the size of the population
